messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Auggie goes to school. It is his first day. He feels very worried. All children feel worried at a new school. But Auggie looks different. So this time is very hard for him.

Other children do not want to sit near him. They look at him. They talk about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes two friends. Jack is a boy in his class. Summer is a girl he talks to at lunch.

But the first day is not the only hard day. Soon, Auggie learns something. His classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid of 'the plague'.

Auggie stays at school all year. He has many big good times and bad times. Then, something happens at a school camp. Nobody expects it. It changes everything very much.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7401 is below the required 0.75. The core message's emotional depth and specific impact are diminished. The text fails to convey the full intensity of Auggie's experience as presented in the original. The simplification has resulted in a loss of critical nuance. For example: The original text describes Auggie's first day as an 'agonising experience'. Your simplification to 'very hard for him' significantly reduces the intensity and unique suffering conveyed by the original. The original text refers to 'many intense ups and downs' and a 'traumatic event'. Your version, 'many big good times and bad times' and 'something happens... Nobody expects it', fails to capture the specific intensity and severity of these experiences. The word 'traumatic' implies a profound negative impact that 'something happens' does not convey. Suggestion: Re-evaluate vocabulary choices to ensure the emotional weight and specific nature of Auggie's challenges are preserved within A2 limits. For 'agonising experience', consider 'a very, very bad time' or 'a time with much pain'. For 'traumatic event', consider 'a very bad and shocking thing' or 'a very sad and scary thing'.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Auggie goes to school. It is his first day. He feels very worried. All children feel worried at a new school. But Auggie looks different. So this time is a very, very bad time for him.

Other children do not want to sit near him. They look at him. They talk about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes two friends. Jack is a boy in his class. Summer is a girl he talks to at lunch.

But the first day is not the only hard day. Soon, Auggie learns something. His classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid of 'the plague'.

Auggie stays at school all year. He has many good times and many very bad times. Then, a very bad and shocking thing happens at a school camp. Nobody expects it. It changes everything very much.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.6604 is significantly below the required 0.75. The core message of the original text, which emphasizes the intense, agonizing, and traumatic nature of Auggie's experience, has been diluted. For example, 'an agonising experience' is simplified to 'a very, very bad time', and 'many intense ups and downs' becomes 'many good times and many very bad times'. The phrase 'unexpected and traumatic event' is reduced to 'a very bad and shocking thing'. These simplifications remove the crucial emotional depth and severity of Auggie's unique struggle, failing to convey the original's core meaning effectively. Suggestion: Rephrase to restore the intensity and specific emotional impact of Auggie's challenges. Use A2-appropriate vocabulary to convey the severity of 'agonising' and 'traumatic' without losing their core meaning.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Auggie goes to school. It is his first day. He feels very worried. All children feel worried at a new school. But Auggie looks different. So this time is very painful for him.

Other children do not want to sit near him. They look at him. They talk about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes two friends. Jack is a boy in his class. Summer is a girl he talks to at lunch.

But the first day is not the only hard day. Soon, Auggie learns something. His classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid of 'the plague'.

Auggie stays at school all year. He has many good times and many very, very hard times. Then, a very bad and surprising thing happens at a school camp. It is a very, very hard time for Auggie. Nobody expects it. It changes everything very much.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Vocabulary Deviation. The text uses the word 'painful' which is classified as B1. For an A2 text, all vocabulary must strictly adhere to the A2 level or below. The presence of a B1 word constitutes a failure to meet the required CEFR standard. The MeaningBERT score of 0.8305 and BERTScore of 0.9148 indicate good preservation of meaning and fidelity, and the CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2, but the specific vocabulary choice is a critical error. Suggestion: Replace 'painful' with a simpler A2 equivalent such as 'very hard' or 'very bad'.

Text saved: Auggie goes to school. It is his first day. He feels very worried. All children feel worried at a new school. But Auggie looks different. So this time is very hard for him.

Other children do not want to sit near him. They look at him. They talk about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes two friends. Jack is a boy in his class. Summer is a girl he talks to at lunch.

But the first day is not the only hard day. Soon, Auggie learns something. His classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid of 'the plague'.

Auggie stays at school all year. He has many good times and many very, very hard times. Then, a very bad and surprising thing happens at a school camp. It is a very, very hard time for Auggie. Nobody expects it. It changes everything very much.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS: The text demonstrates excellent adherence to all CEFR A2 readability standards. It successfully preserves all factual information and the core meaning of the original text, as evidenced by the MeaningBERT score of 0.7998 (above 0.75) and BERTScore of 0.9144 (above 0.90). The CEFR classifier accurately rated the text as A2. The vocabulary is entirely within the A2 level, with no B1 or higher words detected. Sentence structures are consistently short and simple, utilizing only A2-appropriate connectors such as 'and', 'but', and 'so'. The simplification of complex concepts like 'intense ups and downs' to 'many good times and many very, very hard times' and 'unexpected and traumatic event' to 'very bad and surprising thing' is perfectly executed for the A2 level. This is a model A2 simplification.
